p: Based on the Search Tool for the Retrieval of Interacting Genes/Proteins (STRING) database, protein-protein interaction (PPI) networks were constructed using Cytoscape and the plug-ins cytoHubba and ClusterONE were used to identify important DEGs (i.e., potential hub genes) and subnetworks, respectively. For the DEGs in the HYPO, a network with 419 nodes and 787 edges was obtained (PPI enrichment: p < 0.001) and 10 potential hub genes were identified, including up-regulated DEGs in aggression-related GO terms, like brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF, n = 31 degrees) and neurexin-1 (NRXN1, n = 19), as well as important signaling genes, like glutamate metabotropic receptor 2 (GRM2, n = 17) and adenylate cyclase 2 (ADCY2, n = 16) (Fig. 3a). Within the larger network, one subnetwork was identified containing 14 nodes (density = 0.66, p < 0.001; Fig. 3b). The GO processes enriched with the greatest number of DEGs in this subnetwork included G-protein-coupled receptor signaling (GPCR), neuropeptide signaling, regulation of hormone levels, and behavior (Supplementary Table S3, Additional file 1). A network with 13 nodes and 2 edges was obtained in the TnA, but it was not significant (PPI enrichment: p = 0.274).
